documents: Hypertension is a common condition that affects blood pressure levels in the body. It can lead to serious health complications if left untreated.
Diabetes mellitus is a chronic condition characterized by high blood sugar levels. Type 2 diabetes is the most common form.
Asthma is a respiratory condition that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to breathing difficulties.
Heart disease encompasses various conditions affecting the heart and blood vessels, including coronary artery disease and heart failure.
Cancer is a group of diseases characterized by uncontrolled cell growth. Early detection and treatment are crucial for better outcomes.
Osteoporosis is a condition that weakens bones, making them more prone to fractures. It commonly affects older adults.
Arthritis is inflammation of the joints that can cause pain, stiffness, and swelling. There are several types including rheumatoid and osteoarthritis.
Depression is a mental health condition characterized by persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest in activities.
Migraine is a type of headache characterized by severe pain, often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light.
Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in the lungs, causing cough, fever, and difficulty breathing.
Alzheimer's disease is a progressive neurological disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior.
Epilepsy is a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures. It can be managed with medication and lifestyle changes.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a group of lung conditions that cause breathing difficulties.
Thyroid disorders include conditions like hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism, affecting metabolism and energy levels.
Kidney disease can lead to kidney failure if not treated properly. Early detection and management are crucial.
Liver disease encompasses various conditions affecting liver function, including hepatitis and cirrhosis.
Stroke occurs when blood flow to the brain is interrupted, causing brain damage and various symptoms.
Parkinson's disease is a progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement and coordination.
Multiple sclerosis is an autoimmune disease affecting the central nervous system.
HIV/AIDS is a viral infection that weakens the immune system and requires lifelong management.
Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs but can spread to other organs.
Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease causing fever and flu-like symptoms.
Dengue fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing severe flu-like symptoms.
Cholera is a bacterial infection causing severe diarrhea and dehydration.
Ebola is a severe viral disease causing fever, bleeding, and organ failure.
Zika virus is a mosquito-borne infection that can cause birth defects in pregnant women.
Lyme disease is a bacterial infection transmitted by ticks, causing various symptoms.
Hepatitis B and C are viral infections affecting the liver, with different transmission routes.
Influenza is a viral respiratory infection that can cause severe complications.
COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, with varying severity.
Acne is a common skin condition characterized by pimples, blackheads, and whiteheads.
Allergies are immune system reactions to substances that are usually harmless.
Anemia is a condition characterized by a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin.
Anxiety disorders are mental health conditions characterized by excessive worry and fear.
Appendicitis is inflammation of the appendix, requiring surgical removal.
Arthritis treatment includes medication, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes.
Asthma management involves avoiding triggers and using inhalers as prescribed.
Back pain can be caused by various factors including muscle strain and spinal issues.
Bronchitis is inflammation of the bronchial tubes, causing cough and mucus production.
Burns can be classified into first, second, and third-degree based on severity.
Cataracts are clouding of the eye's lens, affecting vision and requiring surgery.
Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten consumption.
Chickenpox is a viral infection causing itchy rash and fever.
Chronic pain management involves various approaches including medication and therapy.
Common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.
Conjunctivitis is inflammation of the eye's outer membrane.
Crohn's disease is an inflammatory bowel disease affecting the digestive tract.
Cystic fibrosis is a genetic disorder affecting the lungs and digestive system.
Dental cavities are decayed areas in teeth requiring fillings or crowns.
Eczema is a skin condition causing itchy, inflamed patches.
Endometriosis is a condition where uterine tissue grows outside the uterus.
Fibromyalgia is a condition causing widespread pain and fatigue.
Food poisoning is caused by consuming contaminated food or water.
Gallstones are solid particles forming in the gallbladder.
Gastritis is inflammation of the stomach lining.
Gastroenteritis is inflammation of the stomach and intestines.
Glaucoma is a group of eye conditions damaging the optic nerve.
Gout is a form of arthritis caused by uric acid crystal buildup.
Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder affecting the thyroid.
Hay fever is an allergic reaction to airborne substances.
Heartburn is a symptom of acid reflux and GERD.
Hemorrhoids are swollen blood vessels in the rectum.
Hepatitis A is a viral infection affecting the liver.
Herpes is a viral infection causing sores and blisters.
High cholesterol can lead to heart disease and stroke.
Hives are itchy, raised welts on the skin.
Hyperthyroidism is overactivity of the thyroid gland.
Hypothyroidism is underactivity of the thyroid gland.
IBS is a functional disorder affecting the large intestine.
Impetigo is a bacterial skin infection causing sores.
Insomnia is difficulty falling or staying asleep.
Iron deficiency can cause fatigue and anemia.
Jaundice is yellowing of the skin and eyes.
Kidney stones are hard deposits forming in the kidneys.
Laryngitis is inflammation of the voice box.
Leukemia is a type of blood cancer.
Lupus is an autoimmune disease affecting multiple organs.
Lyme disease treatment involves antibiotics.
Macular degeneration affects central vision.
Measles is a viral infection causing rash and fever.
Meningitis is inflammation of the membranes around the brain.
Menopause is the natural end of menstrual periods.
Migraine treatment includes medication and lifestyle changes.
Mononucleosis is a viral infection causing fatigue.
Motion sickness causes nausea during travel.
Multiple sclerosis treatment includes medication and therapy.
Muscular dystrophy is a group of genetic muscle diseases.
Narcolepsy is a sleep disorder causing excessive daytime sleepiness.
Nasal polyps are noncancerous growths in the nose.
Nephritis is inflammation of the kidneys.
Neuropathy is damage to the peripheral nerves.
Obesity is excess body fat affecting health.
Osteoarthritis is joint degeneration with age.
Otitis media is middle ear infection.
Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas.
Parasites can cause various infections.
Parkinson's disease treatment includes medication.
Peptic ulcers are sores in the stomach lining.
Peripheral artery disease affects blood flow.
Pink eye is inflammation of the eye's outer membrane.
Plantar fasciitis is heel pain from tissue inflammation.
Pleurisy is inflammation of the lung membranes.
Pneumonia treatment includes antibiotics.
Polio is a viral infection affecting the nervous system.
Post-traumatic stress disorder affects mental health.
Psoriasis is a skin condition causing scaling.
Rabies is a viral infection affecting the brain.
Raynaud's disease affects blood flow to extremities.
Restless leg syndrome causes uncomfortable leg sensations.
Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune joint disease.
Ringworm is a fungal skin infection.
Rosacea is a skin condition causing redness.
Scabies is a skin infestation by mites.
Scoliosis is abnormal spine curvature.
Seasonal affective disorder is depression related to seasons.
Shingles is a viral infection causing painful rash.
Sinusitis is inflammation of the sinuses.
Sleep apnea causes breathing pauses during sleep.
Smallpox was a deadly viral infection.
Spinal stenosis is narrowing of the spinal canal.
Strep throat is a bacterial throat infection.
Stroke treatment requires immediate medical attention.
Sunburn is skin damage from UV radiation.
Tendinitis is inflammation of tendons.
Tetanus is a bacterial infection affecting muscles.
Thalassemia is a genetic blood disorder.
Thrush is a fungal infection in the mouth.
Thyroid cancer affects the thyroid gland.
Tinnitus is ringing in the ears.
Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils.
Tourette syndrome causes involuntary movements.
Tuberculosis treatment requires long-term antibiotics.
Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune condition.
Type 2 diabetes is related to lifestyle factors.
Ulcerative colitis is an inflammatory bowel disease.
Urinary tract infections affect the urinary system.
Varicose veins are swollen blood vessels.
Vertigo is a sensation of spinning.
Vitiligo causes loss of skin color.
Whooping cough is a bacterial respiratory infection.
Wilson's disease affects copper metabolism.
Yellow fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes.
